body:
I did not anticipate anybody to use a relative path such as `xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="vendor/phpunit/phpunit/phpunit.xsd"`. In all projects except for PHPUnit itself, I always use `xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="https://schema.phpunit.de/9.3/phpunit.xsd"`, for instance.

I would like to avoid a special case for the filename of the current schema as this would make the code that deals with different schema versions less consistent / more complicated than it needs to be.

All I'm suggesting is the alias (e.g. a hard copy of or a symlink to the current schema). The code that needs to be aware of multiple versions will use the specific versions. The code that needs the current version will refer to the current version.

The usage of a URL or path that contains a specific version requires additional and easy-to-forget maintenance during PHPUnit upgrades.

> I would like to avoid a special case for the filename of the current schema as this would make the code that deals with different schema versions less consistent / more complicated than it needs to be.

IMO, the usage of different schema versions is the special case currently being optimized for. The usage of the current version is a more common case.

Using "current" scheme just breaks the link between the actual file grammar and the scheme to check it. I believe keeping the scheme versioned is absolutely good decision: it allows user to get a notification when the grammar changes (and that happened in 9.3, BTW).

> it allows user to get a notification when the grammar changes

But isn't it what PHPUnit does internally by using the specific schema version? What I'm talking about is the usage in IDEs where it validates the configuration against the schema. If the "current" approach was used, the user would see that they are using a no longer valid schema even before running PHPUnit.

Another use case where hard-coding the schema version is annoying is automated dependency updates via @dependabot-preview. It will update the PHPUnit version, and if all tests pass, the maintainer may merge the PR w/o even noticing that the schema used in the configuration no longer exists (and that happened in 9.3, BTW).

> I did not anticipate anybody to use a relative path such as `xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="vendor/phpunit/phpunit/phpunit.xsd"`.

To clarify what I meant by that: I consider the file that used to be `/phpunit.xsd` and now is `/schema/9.3.xsd` a private implementation detail of PHPUnit. The public API, if you will, is the `https://schema.phpunit.de/9.3/phpunit.xsd` URL.

> To clarify what I meant by that: I consider the file that used to be `/phpunit.xsd` and now is `/schema/9.3.xsd` a private implementation detail of PHPUnit. The public API, if you will, is the `https://schema.phpunit.de/9.3/phpunit.xsd` URL.

This justifies the non-BC-breaking nature of this change which isn't a concern here. The concern is the absence of the public API for the current schema version.

rename.from: Create an alias for the current configuration schema
rename.to: Location for (current version of) XML Schema for XML configuration file has changed

issue.title: Missing schema file for 9.3
issue.body:
| Q                   | A
| --------------------| ---------------
| PHPUnit version     | 9.3
| PHP version         | any
| Installation Method | any

#### Summary

The URL https://schema.phpunit.de/9.3/phpunit.xsd doesn't return the XML schema.

#### Current behavior

Fetching the URL returns a HTTP 200 response but with `404: Not found` in its body:
```
$ curl -i https://schema.phpunit.de/9.3/phpunit.xsd
HTTP/2 200
server: nginx
date: Sun, 09 Aug 2020 11:14:25 GMT
content-type: application/octet-stream
content-length: 14
last-modified: Sun, 09 Aug 2020 04:13:50 GMT
etag: "5f2f77fe-e"
strict-transport-security: max-age=63072000; includeSubDomains; preload
referrer-policy: no-referrer
x-frame-options: DENY
x-content-type-options: nosniff
x-xss-protection: 1; mode=block
content-security-policy: default-src 'none'; script-src 'self'; object-src 'none'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data:; media-src 'none'; frame-src 'none'; font-src 'self'; connect-src 'self'
accept-ranges: bytes

404: Not Found
```

Maybe this has something to do with the changes in sebastianbergmann/phpunit#4405?

body: @sebastianbergmann given the logic implemented in `SchemaFinder::find()` by e2b5eeac543b699867a85391e2bfe039450b881c, is it now safe to rely on `schema/phpunit.xsd` being part of the PHPUnit library or it's still an implementation detail?

issue.title: Update PHPUnit to 9.4
issue.body:
1. Restore previous XSD paths (https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4405).
2. Remove the no longer needed version constraint for `nikic/php-parser`.
3. Remove `error_reporting` configuration.

issue.title: Add PHP8 support

labels.name: hacktoberfest-accepted
labels.description: Issues/Pull-Requests which can be fixed during Hacktoberfest: https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com

issue.body:
|    Q          |   A
|-------------- | ------
| Documentation |no
| Bugfix        | no
| BC Break      | no
| New Feature   | yes
| RFC           | no
| QA            | no

### Description
Closes #5 

- [X] Modify `composer.json` to provide support for PHP 8.0 by adding the constraint `~8.0.0`
- [X] Modify `composer.json` to drop support for PHP less than 7.3
- [X] Modify `composer.json` to implement phpunit 9.3 which supports PHP 7.3+
- [X] Modify `.travis.yml` to ignore platform requirements when installing composer dependencies (simply add `--ignore-platform-reqs` to `COMPOSER_ARGS` env variable)
- [X] Modify `.travis.yml` to add PHP 8.0 to the matrix (_NOTE_: Do not allow failures as PHP 8.0 has a feature freeze since 2020-08-04!)

body: Seems to me that the Laravel Installer should use that absolute namespace too.

issue.title: Presteamshop v2
issue.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced Doctrine ORM entities and repositories for payments, refunds, histories, and customer cards.
  - Added service classes for payment processing, order management, and payment option generation.
  - Implemented new admin and front-end controllers for AJAX refund handling and customer card management.
  - Added comprehensive translation files and new Smarty templates for admin order views and customer card display.
  - Included JavaScript modules for admin refund UI and front-end card deletion with confirmation dialogs.
  - Added PHP-CS-Fixer configuration and PHPUnit setup for code quality and testing.
  - Introduced YAML service configuration files for dependency injection and service management.
  - Added database upgrade script for migrating to new schema version 2.0.0.
  - Added new checkout page CSS styling for payment forms and options.
  - Added front controller for Apple Pay domain verification.

- **Improvements**
  - Refactored payment and refund logic to use service layers and repositories, improving maintainability.
  - Enhanced error handling and user feedback in AJAX operations and payment workflows.
  - Streamlined configuration, autoloading, and dependency declarations for better modularity.
  - Updated payment creation and order update flows to delegate to dedicated services.
  - Restricted "Save Card details" option display to logged-in users with tokenization enabled.
  - Improved UI logic for toggling production and test API key inputs in admin settings.
  - Enhanced refund form validation and confirmation dialogs with user-friendly alerts.
  - Updated payment option rendering to support multiple CSS class selectors and browser detection.
  - Simplified admin order refund and payment UI with new tabbed interface and JSON viewers.
  - Improved breadcrumb navigation and AJAX card deletion in customer account area.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Fixed refund validation and error reporting in admin interface.
  - Resolved issues with displaying and deleting saved cards in the customer account area.

- **Removals**
  - Removed legacy API client classes, models, helpers, and traits related to Monei integration.
  - Deleted old database tables and replaced with redesigned schema and entities.
  - Removed deprecated JavaScript and Smarty templates in favor of new modular components.
  - Removed legacy PHP cURL wrapper and related utility classes.
  - Removed obsolete configuration and documentation tabs from admin panel.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
